description: a(1) = 1; for n>1, a(n)=n/(largest prime dividing n).
comments: For n>1, a(n)=1 if and only if n is prime. - _Zak Seidov_, Feb 09 2015
links: R. Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
maple: a := n -> `if`(n=1, 1, n/max(numtheory[factorset](n)));seq(a(n), n=1..97); # _Peter Luschny_, Jul 28 2014
mathematica: a052126[n_] := Array[If[n == 1, 1, #/FactorInteger[#][[-1]][[1]]] &, n]; a052126[97] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Dec 21 2014 *)
prog: (PARI) gpf(n)=my(f=factor(n)[,1]); f[#f]a(n)=if(n<4,return(1)); n/gpf(n) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Apr 28 2015
author: _James A. Sellers_, Jan 21 2000
